Scenario:

2- Click on Add
3- Select Apache access log.
4- Browse for Apache_access.log file, then click OK
5- Click Finish

While trying to import Common Base Event XML Log, the same error message was displayed.  I am attaching part of the error log file.

Created an attachment (id=42739)
Log_TPTP.txt
Is the log file that you are trying to import in a folder that has NL characters?
Can you provide more information on the path of the folder where the log file is located. Are you testing on a native arabic Linux or englsih with eclipse running with -nl ar?
And actually one more question, in the import log wizard "Add log file" dialog what have you chosen in the character encoding combo box? DEFAULT or ISO8859_1?
Try to import again using the encoding ISO8859_1, it seems that I missed to specify it in the test case.

I suspect this may be a translation problem.  A similar problem occurred with some translations of the TPTP 4.0 level of code. See https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=137295. I do not have access to download the NL pack from the link specified so I cannot confirm this.  Can you please attach the translated plugin.properties file for org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter plugin for the languages that have this problem (Brazilian Portuguese and Arabic).

Created an attachment (id=42771)
org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.nlBidi\plugin_ar.properties

Aattaching arabic translated org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter\plugin.properties file.

Based on the attached properties file I have confirmed that this is the same problem as indicated in https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=137295.  Strings below the following lines have been translated but they should not be translated.

#====================================================================
# %%% END OF TRANSLATED PROPERTIES %%%
#====================================================================

Code functionality is affected by translating those strings.  Log Import operations cannot be performed because of these translations.

A indicated in the other defect, bugzillas have been opened to remove these code strings from the properties file but it is too risky to do it at this stage of the 4.2 release.  This will be fixed in the next release.  Therefore the translated properties files need to be fixed.  You can do this by copying and pasting the non-translatable section of the English plugin.properties file to the translated properites files, overwriting the section that was translated. 

Cam-Thu, I am reassigning this to you to have the translated properties files fixed.
Reassigning to Kit as suggested by Eugene Chan

The problem is caused by translations below the "END OF TRANSLATED PROPERTIES" section in eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter\plugin.properties.

If you have this problem, please un-translate strings below the "END OF TRANSLATED PROPERTIES" section in eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter\plugin.properties.
[Added by CDE: Completed by the CDE Bridge]
The Brazilian Portuguese file was fixed and re-delivered today. All strings after the "END OF TRANSLATED PROPERTIES" section were left in English.

I have untraslated all strings as indicated.  I have also placed eclipse and the log file under a directory that dose not include any national characters.  However, the problem still exists.  This is a seriouse problem since it deals with a basic and recurrent functionality.  I kindly urge you to give it top priority.

Answering the questions:

- The Log file has No National Characters.  However, by default, numerals in the log file are displayed using national digits.
- The path for The log file is C:\
- Testing is on native Arabic Windows.  Locale set to Arabic (Egypt).
- When importing the log file, the encoding is set to ISO8859_1, and set to default, and in both cases, the importing fails.
Looking at this in iteration 4.

Can you please attach the Apache access log being imported and the Eclipse .metadata/.log file.

Can you also include what version of Linux you are using.

- The testing environment is Native Windows XP.  Locale set to Arabic.

I am attaching the log file.

apache_access.zip

I tried the new NL pack and found the same problem as bugzilla 138281.  When importing Apache access log with static parser (the default) I received an error dialog box which I will attach.  When I imported with the rules parser, all records were imported but all creationTime values were zero.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 138281 ***

Created an attachment (id=43547)
Error dialog box when importing Apache access log with static parser

My scenario is different than bugzilla 138281.  I am reopening this defect because it is blocking TVT test cases.

If you have a work arround, or an alternate scenario, please provide them to me.

There is no workaround for this problem.  Please test with the next TPTP driver that includes the fix for bugzilla 138281.  A driver with the fix is not available yet.  Please use the next driver after 200606060100.

Do you receive an error message like the one I attached in Comment #26 ?
Yes, the error I receive is similar to the one in #26.
Please retest with a recent TPTP 4.2 driver (eg. http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/drops/TPTP-4.2.0-200606110100.html).
Resolving this bugzilla as the problem should be fixed.  Please retest with a current driver and re-open if there is still a problem.
